title: Amanda Holden broken leg doesn't stop her at John Torode wedding
text:
Amanda didn’t let her busted leg stop her (Picture: Charlie Condou/Instagram)

Amanda Holden has been through the mill after breaking her leg in two places while on an inflatable water assault course on holiday.

But a pesky broken fibula wasn’t getting in the way of Mandy seeing two of her friends get hitched.

The 48-year-old got all dolled up, bandages be damned, to attend the wedding of John Torode and Lisa Faulkner.

The couple, who met on Celebrity MasterChef, tied the knot yesterday at Aynhoe Park in front of friends, family and celebrities – and among them was Amanda, who was forced to rock bandages and one trainer with her gorgeous pink dress.

Lisa and John tied the knot yesterday (Picture: Dave Benett/Getty Images for J Sheekey Atlantic Bar)

Amanda didn’t look too happy (Picture: @charliecondou)

In a now-deleted Instagram post from former Corrie star Charlie Condou, the Britain’s Got Talent star could be seen perched on a walker chair, with crutches on both arms.

Advertisement

Amanda wore a dusky pink dress with voluminous sleeves and a white belt buckle, but seemed unimpressed about the cast sticking out from underneath it, as she pouted at the camera.

Still, we’re sure the nuptials cheered her up.

The former Cutting It actress was on holidays with her husband Chris and daughters Alexa, 13, and Hollie, seven, when she snapped her fibula in two places.

Amanda broke her leg on holiday (Picture: Amanda Holden/Instagram)

Lisa Faulkner gave fans a glimpse into her wedding celebrations (Picture: Instagram)

Speaking on Heart, Amanda explained: ‘Yeah so basically I was trying to be a good mother Jamie and I put my book down, I put down the Uno cards… and I said to Hollie “Mummy can come on that with you” and there’s this like, you remember [Total] Wipeout, that TV thing? There’s like a children’s Total Wipeout thing in the middle of the sea and … I thought yeah I can do that.

‘So Hollie was doing brilliantly and going round it. I walked around it and then crawled across like an old person, like across the difficult bits.

‘And then there were these three inflatable stepping stones in the middle of the sea and everyone else was running across it and I thought “oh I could do that, if kids can do it I can do it” and I did it and I made it – I was showing off Jamie – I made it across to the other side and then my leg slipped ’cause obviously its wet, like an inflatable thing in the sea, my leg slipped and it went the other way and I felt it break and I fell in to the sea and I had to swim back to the shore one-legged.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Amanda had immediate surgery to have a metal plate fitted in her leg.

Gregg was there to support John (Picture: @greggawallace)

Charlie, Amanda and Tamzin were having a scream (Picture: @charliecondou)

The star was in good company to watch MasterChef star John and EastEnders star Lisa tie the knot in Banbury.

As well as Amanda and Charlie, John’s MasterChef buddy Gregg Wallace documented his journey to the venue, while Tamzin Outhwaite and former Holby City stars Angela Griffin and Nicola Stephenson were in attendance.

We’re yet to see Lisa’s wedding dress, but the 47-year-old shared a picture of herself in her pyjamas as she excitedly prepared for her big day.

John, 54, proposed to Lisa on Christmas Day in 2018, after six-and-a-half years of dating.

It was a Holby City reunion (Picture: @charliecondou)

However, the foodie revealed his bride actually forgot to say ‘yes’ to his proposal for three hours after he popped the question. Which is a long time to spend down on one knee.

Discussing his festival proposal on Good Morning Britain, the BBC star confessed: ‘I did and she said “yes” which was really lovely.

‘In fact, she didn’t yes for three and a half hours because she was so gobsmacked. ‘I remember saying to her, “Are you going to say yes?” and she went, “Have I not said yes?” I went, “No you have not said yes yet”.’

Let’s hope she managed to get her vows out a little quicker…
